description.narrative: Key programme objectivesThe programme goal is to contribute to national food security, particularly rural household food security, and poverty alleviation. The development objective is to increase smallholder agricultural production and productivity.Policy and institutional objectivesThe programme will support: (i) the establishment of a national framework for smallholder agriculture, laying the foundation for the medium to long term development of this segment of agriculture; (ii) the development of agricultural water resources through the adoption of a watershed approach and the use of watershed characterization and related hydrometry studies to interlink rainfed and irrigated rangeland systems; (iii) the sustainable productivity of agriculture, including livestock, through the adoption by smallholders and subsistence farmers of a modern approach, including improved crop water management, application of fertilizers and use of improved seeds of better crop varieties; (iv) technology generation and dissemination; (v) community-focused development that responds well to the expressed needs of participating communities; (vi) the formulation of straightforward policies, with enhanced participation by the private sector and smallholders in decision-making and financing; and (vii) the building of a streamlined institutional framework that avoids conflict and enhances transparency and accountability.
This point represents the centroid of the project area. For more detailed geographic information, please refer to the project page on the IFAD website.
